feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is intentionally superseded by payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required, and there is no automatic formula inheritance or synchronization.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll deduction discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, requiring manual intervention to ensure accurate leave deduction calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Year
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator does not correctly account for leap years. When calculating gratuity for an employee with service spanning 2024 (a leap year), the system counts 365 days instead of 366 days, resulting in an incorrect total service period (607 days instead of 608 days) and an incorrect gratuity amount (AED 10,476.98 instead of AED 10,494.24).
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts is consistently producing slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results show amounts less by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals across all employee calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation affecting pro-rated amount accuracy.
known_issues.gap_statement: Enhanced rounding and decimal handling mechanisms are needed to ensure exact financial calculations for pro-rated amounts.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculation (Bayzat: AED 231,821.10, Manual: AED 252,485)
known_issues.limitation_statement: Potential minor variance in gratuity calculation between system and manual methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation method may need further verification to align with manual calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Handling Leap Year Days Transparently
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not transparently handle February 29th in leap years, causing slight discrepancies in total service days calculation (912 vs 913 days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not clearly defined or consistently applied.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration and gratuity calculations.

known_issues.title: Nuanced Gratuity Calculation Logic
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a complex calculation methodology for gratuity that differs from manual expectations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic is intricate and not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Extra Day Added in Gratuity Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially causing slight variations in gratuity calculations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation, adding one extra day to total service duration

known_issues.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform uses a hardcoded daily wage calculation of (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic × 12 / 365)
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a fixed 30-day divisor that cannot be modified
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in daily wage computation method prevents customization for different organizational calculation preferences

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on a fixed daily rate configuration in policy, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The specific case involved dividing daily wage by 30 days instead of 31 days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including daily rate divisor configurations | No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days variation impacts leave salary accrual consistency
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not match user's initial expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Inability to handle dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: Clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between the Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts due to a timing mismatch in working days calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically recalculate daily wage deductions when public holiday configurations change after leave request creation.
known_issues.gap_statement: Module communication enhancement needed to ensure Time Off module sends complete leave request details to Payroll module for consistent salary deduction calculation.

known_issues.title: Daily Wage Calculation Produces Unexpected Deduction Amounts
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can result in deduction amounts that don't precisely match the expected monthly salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a non-standard 30.42-day divisor, which can produce deduction amounts different from user expectations
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary amounts

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains accurate, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-level leave calculation settings. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a system-wide daily rate instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display logic recalculates rates based on payroll processing month instead of storing the rate from original leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for employees working more or fewer than 26 days

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
limitations.limitation_statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be applied.
limitations.impact: Users must configure daily wage calculations in payroll settings to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or updated with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Period
limitations.limitation_statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years when calculating total service period for gratuity computations.
limitations.impact: Potential underpayment of employee end of service benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Daily Wage Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The daily wage calculation (basic + allowances / 30) produces systematically slightly lower pro-rated amounts by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
limitations.impact: Potential financial discrepancies in end of service settlements for employees leaving mid-month

limitations.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued only at end of month, not prorated for partial months
limitations.impact: Leave balance for mid-month departures not automatically included in EOS calculation

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Departure Date Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules about whether the departure date is counted as a working day, leading to potential variations in service duration calculation.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity amount calculation

limitations.title: Complex Partial Year Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: System calculates partial years using specific day-counting logic, including leap year adjustments (using 366 as divisor when applicable)
limitations.impact: Potential calculation discrepancies between manual and system calculations

limitations.title: Daily Wage Calculation Constraint
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot retroactively adjust daily wage calculations when public holidays are added after initial payroll processing.

limitations.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify daily wage divisor or calculation method per individual leave request

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Constraints
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculator can be set to 'working days' or 'custom days' for leave encashment, which directly impacts accrual calculations
limitations.impact: Calculation method determines whether daily wage varies monthly or remains consistent

limitations.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Inconsistent salary calculations across different payroll scenarios

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may appear different depending on how work week is configured for each employee or organization

limitations.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past; fails for future departure dates
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions with payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have status changes.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to remove

limitations.title: Fixed 30.42 Days Divisor for Wage Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: The system uses a fixed 30.42-day divisor for calculating daily wages, which differs from calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction calculations may not align exactly with expected monthly salary amounts

limitations.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates, potentially causing display inaccuracies for months with fewer days, particularly February in leap years.
limitations.impact: Potential user confusion due to incorrect remarks, though actual calculations remain mathematically correct

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unable to automatically prorate salary based on working days
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Current payroll system lacks dynamic salary calculation capabilities
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually track overtime and unpaid leaves separately for each employee, using a mix of unpaid leaves and overtime tracking

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Greyed out formula in leave policy suggests override
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Payroll settings have configured a different daily wage calculation method that takes precedence
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify and configure daily wage calculator in payroll settings to ensure correct unpaid leave deductions

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity calculation for employee with service in leap year
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses 365-day year calculation instead of recognizing 366 days in leap years
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually adjust calculation to use 366 days for leap years when computing service period

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Consistently lower pro-rated amounts by small decimal points
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Decimal precision error in daily wage calculation formula
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify and potentially adjust final settlement amounts

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy in gratuity calculation between system and manual methods
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Calculation involves complex service duration splitting and tiered daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year after)
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculation using daily wage divided by 30, applying different rates for service duration segments

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Discrepancy between system-calculated and manually edited gratuity amount
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Client can manually override the system's gratuity calculation with their own computed value
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify manual calculation against system calculation, paying special attention to leap year day inclusion

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Calculation differences between manual and system calculations
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation:
System uses specific methodology for calculating service duration, including:
1. Segmenting service period into different tiers (first 5 years vs above 5 years)
2. Different daily rates for each tier (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year above 5 years)
3. Precise day counting for partial years, including leap year adjustments
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify calculation by breaking down service period into precise segments and using system's specific day-counting logic

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Differences in daily wage and days worked calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Fixed 30-day divisor and potential rounding differences in service duration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually verify calculations by breaking down days worked, unpaid leave, and applying the platform's fixed calculation method

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System uses fixed daily rate configuration from leave policy, which may not match user's manual calculation expectations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify daily rate configuration in leave policy and understand the system's calculation logic before challenging the computed amount

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected differences in leave salary accrual totals
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculator set to 'working days' method causes monthly calculation variations
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Switch to 'custom days' setting for more consistent leave encashment calculations

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Verify work week configuration to understand how working days are calculated
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Check employee's assigned work week and confirm if all days are marked as working days

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Full monthly salary displayed for partially worked month
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System's proration logic does not account for departure date relative to payroll processing date
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manually calculate prorated salary based on days worked (e.g., 21,000/30 * 15 days = 10,500 AED)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Duplicate or persistent payroll deductions after leave request modifications
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Lack of automatic synchronization between leave management and payroll deduction systems
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual intervention required to remove incorrect deductions. May need backend cleanup or support ticket to resolve persistent deductions.

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Incorrect salary deduction for unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Misalignment between Time Off and Payroll modules due to public holiday configuration changes
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Manual deduction adjustment or reopening previous payroll cycles (not recommended)

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Unexpected deduction amount for unpaid leave
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Daily wage calculated by dividing monthly salary (4300 AED) by 30.42, resulting in a daily rate of 141.35 AED
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify unpaid leave policy settings and understand the 30.42-day divisor calculation method

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Mismatch between displayed daily rate and actual calculation
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Remarks field shows incorrect number of days, but actual deduction calculation uses correct calendar days
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Verify actual deduction amount against system calculation, not just the remarks text

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: Daily rate shows incorrect month for leave deduction
troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System recalculates daily rate based on payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: A fix was deployed to store the initially calculated daily rate and display that amount on the 'daily rate' label

Salary reduction based on number of calendar days in a month, calculated by dividing monthly salary by actual days in the month and multiplying by unpaid days

Calculated as (Basic Salary + Allowances) / Working Days, excluding public holidays

claims_to_validate.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings overrides the formula configured in leave policy for unpaid leave. The leave policy formula appears greyed out, indicating it is intentionally superseded by payroll settings. This creates user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll deduction discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Year
claims_to_validate.statement: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator does not correctly account for leap years. When calculating gratuity for an employee with service spanning 2024 (a leap year), the system counts 365 days instead of 366 days, resulting in an incorrect total service period (607 days instead of 608 days) and an incorrect gratuity amount (AED 10,476.98 instead of AED 10,494.24).

claims_to_validate.title: End of Service Pro-Rated Amount Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculation for pro-rated amounts is consistently producing slightly lower amounts due to decimal precision errors. The formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but results show amounts less by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals across all employee calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculation (Bayzat: AED 231,821.10, Manual: AED 252,485)

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Not Handling Leap Year Days Transparently
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not transparently handle February 29th in leap years, causing slight discrepancies in total service days calculation (912 vs 913 days).

claims_to_validate.title: Nuanced Gratuity Calculation Logic
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a complex calculation methodology for gratuity that differs from manual expectations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting.

claims_to_validate.title: Extra Day Added in Gratuity Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing job tenure, potentially causing slight variations in gratuity calculations.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Method
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform uses a hardcoded daily wage calculation of (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic × 12 / 365)

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Divisor Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on a fixed daily rate configuration in policy, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The specific case involved dividing daily wage by 30 days instead of 31 days, resulting in a slight salary amount difference.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., on Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., on Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: When public holidays are added after a leave request is created, the daily wage calculation becomes misaligned between the Time Off and Payroll modules. This causes incorrect salary deduction amounts due to a timing mismatch in working days calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Produces Unexpected Deduction Amounts
claims_to_validate.statement: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can result in deduction amounts that don't precisely match the expected monthly salary.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual policy-level leave calculation settings. Unpaid leave deductions are calculated using a system-wide daily rate instead of policy-specific methods, potentially leading to incorrect salary deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month when leave occurred.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month, calculated from 365 annual days minus 52 weekly offs, resulting in 313 working days divided by 12 months.

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formula
claims_to_validate.statement: For unpaid leave, the daily wage calculator configured in payroll settings takes precedence over the leave policy formula. The leave policy formula is greyed out and cannot be applied.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Config Creation Impacts Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Unpaid leave deductions depend on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Handling of Leap Year Days in Service Period
claims_to_validate.statement: The system defaults to 365 days per year, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years when calculating total service period for gratuity computations.

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Daily Wage Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculation (basic + allowances / 30) produces systematically slightly lower pro-rated amounts by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.

claims_to_validate.title: Monthly Leave Accrual Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued only at end of month, not prorated for partial months

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Departure Date Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules about whether the departure date is counted as a working day, leading to potential variations in service duration calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Complex Partial Year Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates partial years using specific day-counting logic, including leap year adjustments (using 366 as divisor when applicable)

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Calculation Constraint
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot retroactively adjust daily wage calculations when public holidays are added after initial payroll processing.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Leave Salary Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Method Constraints
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculator can be set to 'working days' or 'custom days' for leave encashment, which directly impacts accrual calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Calculation Methods for Leave and Proration
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Salary Proration Based on Departure Date

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot automatically reconcile leave transactions with payroll deductions when leave requests are modified, deleted, or have status changes.

claims_to_validate.title: February Days Calculation Limitation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system may default to 31 days when calculating daily rates, potentially causing display inaccuracies for months with fewer days, particularly February in leap years.

claims_to_validate.title: Global Settings Override Policy Configurations
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
